flowerlist.instructions: Large double. Good grower, heavy bloomer. Early to mid-season, acid loving plants. Plant in moist well drained soil with pH of 4.0-5.5.
flowerlist.name: Azalea

flowerlist.instructions: Beautiful large royal purple flowers adorn attractive satiny green leaves that turn orange\/red in cold weather. Grows to up to 18 feet, or prune annually to shorten.
flowerlist.name: Tibouchina Semidecandra

flowerlist.instructions: Blooms in summer, 20-35 inches high. Fertilize regularly for best results. Full sun, drought tolerant.
flowerlist.name: Hibiscus

flowerlist.instructions: Quick-growing, herbaceous, shrub reaching up to 30 inches in height, forming a rounded, dense bush.
flowerlist.name: Plectranthus

flowerlist.instructions: Slow growing, upright to spreading shrub. Oval, glossy, leaves and profuse winter to spring blooming flowers.
flowerlist.name: Camellia Japonica

flowerlist.instructions: Thorny woody vine scrambles over other plants with their hooked thorns. Pest free.
flowerlist.name: Bougainvillea Spectabilis

flowerlist.instructions: Deep purple colored flowers bushy rounded growth habit to 3 feet tall. Plant in full sun. Water regularly.
flowerlist.name: Rosa Burgundy

flowerlist.instructions: Deep purple colored flowers bushy rounded growth habit to 3 feet tall. Plant in full sun. Water regularly.
flowerlist.name: Rosa Iceberg

flowerlist.instructions: They do not thrive indoors, where the light is too dim, and humidity too low, for them to grow properly.
flowerlist.name: Bonsai Tree

flowerlist.instructions: Blooms continuously from early spring to first frost. Full sun or part shade, moist well-drained soil.
flowerlist.name: Calibrachoa Noa
